sections.purpose: To describe the procedure for sterilization of laboratory materials using an autoclave.
sections.scope: Applicable to sterilization activities in the Microbiology laboratory.
procedure: Ensure the autoclave chamber is clean.
Add sufficient water to the autoclave as per manufacturer instructions.
Load materials to be sterilized without overcrowding.
Close the lid securely and set temperature and pressure.
Allow the autoclave cycle to complete.
After pressure returns to zero, open the lid carefully.
Remove sterilized materials and allow them to cool.
sections.precautions: Do not open the autoclave under pressure. Use heat-resistant gloves while handling sterilized materials.
